AccountMapping.description: Account mapping schema that establishes a connection between a PagerDuty account and a Jira Cloud instance, enabling integration and synchronization between the two platforms.

created_at.description: The time the account mapping was created.

jira_cloud_account.description: Details of the Jira Cloud instance connected to the PagerDuty account.

base_url.description: The base URL of the Jira Cloud instance, used for API calls and constructing links (e.g., 'https://your-domain.atlassian.net').

pagerduty_account.description: Details of the PagerDuty account involved in this integration.

subdomain.description: The unique subdomain of the PagerDuty account, used to identify and access the account (e.g., 'example' in 'example.pagerduty.com').

updated_at.description: The time the account mapping was last updated.

AccountMapping.title: AccountMapping

AccountMappingPaginatedResponse.description:
A paginated response schema for returning a list of account mappings between PagerDuty and Jira Cloud.
This structure allows for efficient retrieval and navigation through large sets of account mappings.

accounts_mappings.description:
An array of AccountMapping objects representing one page of results.
Each object in this array describes a connection between a PagerDuty account and a Jira Cloud instance.

AccountMappingPaginatedResponse.title: AccountMappingPaginatedResponse

Limit.description: The number of results per page.

externalDocs.description: See our Pagination Docs for more information.

Limit.title: Limit

More.description: Indicates if there are additional records to return.

externalDocs.description: See our Pagination Docs for more information.

More.title: More

Offset.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

externalDocs.description: See our Pagination Docs for more information.

Offset.title: Offset

Rule.description: Rule schema represents a configuration for bidirectional synchronization between Jira issues and PagerDuty incidents.

account_mapping.description: Represents the association between the PagerDuty account and the Jira Cloud instance.

self.description: The API URL where this account mapping object can be accessed

autocreate_jql_disabled_reason.description: If auto-creation using JQL is disabled, this field provides the reason for the disablement.

autocreate_jql_disabled_until.description: The timestamp until which the auto-creation using JQL feature is disabled.

config.description: Detailed configuration for bidirectional synchronization between Jira issues and PagerDuty incidents.

jira.description: Jira-specific configuration settings for issue creation and synchronization.

autocreate_jql.description: JQL query to automatically create PagerDuty incidents when matching Jira issues are created. Leave empty to disable this feature.

create_issue_on_incident_trigger.description: When enabled, automatically creates a Jira issue whenever a PagerDuty incident is triggered.

custom_fields.description: Defines mappings for custom fields between PagerDuty incidents and Jira issues.

source_incident_field.description: The PagerDuty incident field to be mapped, if applicable.

target_issue_field.description: The Jira issue field ID to which the PagerDuty field will be mapped.

target_issue_name.description: The human-readable name of the Jira issue field.

type.description: The data type of the custom field.

value.description: The value to be set for the custom field, if applicable.

issue_type.description: Specifies the Jira issue type to be created or synchronized with PagerDuty incidents.

priorities.description: Maps PagerDuty incident priorities to Jira issue priorities for synchronization.

jira_id.description: The ID of the Jira priority.

pagerduty_id.description: The ID of the corresponding PagerDuty priority.

project.description: Defines the Jira project where issues will be created or synchronized.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Jira project.

key.description: Unique identifier key for the Jira project.

project_type_key.description: Indicates the type of Jira project (e.g., software, business)

status_mapping.description: Maps PagerDuty incident statuses to corresponding Jira issue statuses for synchronization.

acknowledged.description: Optional Jira status to be set when a PagerDuty incident is acknowledged.

resolved.description: Optional Jira status to be set when a PagerDuty incident is resolved.

triggered.description: Jira status to be set when a PagerDuty incident is triggered.

sync_notes_user.description: Jira user account used for syncing notes and comments between Jira issues and PagerDuty incidents. If not provided, note synchronization is disabled.

self.description: The API URL for this service.

service.description: The PagerDuty service associated with this rule.

html_url.description: The web URL for viewing this service in the PagerDuty UI.

self.description: The API URL for this service.

summary.description: A name or summary of the PagerDuty service

version.description: The version number of this configuration.

created_at.description: The timestamp when this rule was initially created.

enabled.description: Indicates whether the rule is currently active (true) or inactive (false) for synchronization.

name.description: A descriptive name for the rule, typically matching the Jira project name for easy identification.

updated_at.description: The timestamp of the last update to this rule, if any.

Rule.title: Rule

RulePaginatedResponse.description:
A paginated response schema for returning a list of rules between PagerDuty incidents and Jira Cloud issues.
This structure facilitates efficient retrieval and navigation through potentially large sets of integration rules,
allowing for better performance and resource management when dealing with numerous configuration rules.

rules.description:
An array of Rule objects representing one page of results.
Each Rule object in this array defines a specific configuration for synchronizing PagerDuty incidents with Jira Cloud issues.
These rules determine how incidents and issues are created, updated, and linked between the two platforms.

RulePaginatedResponse.title: RulePaginatedResponse

RuleRequest.description:
Schema for creating rules between PagerDuty incidents and Jira issues.
This schema defines the structure for configuring bidirectional synchronization, including
issue creation, field mapping, status synchronization, and custom field configurations.

config.description:
Detailed configuration object for bidirectional synchronization between Jira issues
and PagerDuty incidents. This includes settings for both Jira and PagerDuty, defining
how incidents and issues should be created, updated, and linked between the two systems.

jira.description:
Jira-specific configuration settings for issue creation and synchronization.
This object defines how PagerDuty incidents are represented in Jira, including
project details, issue types, status mappings, and custom field configurations.

autocreate_jql.description: JQL query to automatically create PagerDuty incidents when matching Jira issues are created. Leave empty to disable this feature.

create_issue_on_incident_trigger.description: When enabled, automatically creates a Jira issue whenever a PagerDuty incident is triggered.

custom_fields.description: Defines mappings for custom fields between PagerDuty incidents and Jira issues.

source_incident_field.description: The PagerDuty incident field to be mapped.

target_issue_field.description: The Jira issue field ID to which the PagerDuty field will be mapped.

target_issue_name.description: The human-readable name of the Jira issue field.

type.description: The data type of the custom field.

value.description: The value to be set for the custom field, if applicable.

issue_type.description: Specifies the Jira issue type to be created or synchronized with PagerDuty incidents.

priorities.description: Maps PagerDuty incident priorities to Jira issue priorities for synchronization.

jira_id.description: The ID of the Jira priority.

pagerduty_id.description: The ID of the corresponding PagerDuty priority.

project.description: Defines the Jira project where issues will be created or synchronized.

status_mapping.description: Maps PagerDuty incident statuses to corresponding Jira issue statuses for synchronization.

acknowledged.description: Jira status to be set when a PagerDuty incident is acknowledged.

resolved.description: Jira status to be set when a PagerDuty incident is resolved.

triggered.description: Jira status to be set when a PagerDuty incident is triggered.

sync_notes_user.description: Jira user account used for syncing notes and comments between Jira issues and PagerDuty incidents. If not provided, note synchronization is disabled.

service.description: The PagerDuty service associated with this rule.

enabled.description:
Indicates whether the rule is currently active (true) or inactive (false).
When active, the rule will apply the defined synchronization logic between PagerDuty
incidents and Jira issues. Inactive rules are stored but do not affect synchronization.

name.description:
A descriptive name for the rule. It's recommended to use a name that
reflects the purpose of the rule, such as the Jira project name or the type of incidents
being synchronized, for easy identification and management.

RuleRequest.title: RuleRequest

RuleUpdateRequest.description:
Schema for updating rules between PagerDuty incidents and Jira issues.
This schema defines the structure for configuring bidirectional synchronization, including
issue creation, field mapping, status synchronization, and custom field configurations.

config.description:
Detailed configuration object for bidirectional synchronization between Jira issues
and PagerDuty incidents. This includes settings for both Jira and PagerDuty, defining

target_issue_field.description: The Jira issue field ID to which the PagerDuty field will be mapped.

target_issue_name.description: The human-readable name of the Jira issue field.

type.description: The data type of the custom field.

value.description: The value to be set for the custom field, if applicable.

issue_type.description: Specifies the Jira issue type to be created or synchronized with PagerDuty incidents.

priorities.description: Maps PagerDuty incident priorities to Jira issue priorities for synchronization.

jira_id.description: The ID of the Jira priority.

pagerduty_id.description: The ID of the corresponding PagerDuty priority.

status_mapping.description: Maps PagerDuty incident statuses to corresponding Jira issue statuses for synchronization.

acknowledged.description: Jira status to be set when a PagerDuty incident is acknowledged.

resolved.description: Jira status to be set when a PagerDuty incident is resolved.

triggered.description: Jira status to be set when a PagerDuty incident is triggered.

sync_notes_user.description: Jira user account used for syncing notes and comments between Jira issues and PagerDuty incidents. If not provided, note synchronization is disabled.

Indicates whether the rule is currently active (true) or inactive (false).

reflects the purpose of the rule, such as the Jira project name or the type of incidents

info.description:
This is the API documentation for PagerDuty's integration with Jira Cloud.

Additional integration documentation can be found here: https://support.pagerduty.com/main/docs/jira-cloud.
info.title: PagerDuty Jira Cloud Integration API

get.description:
Retrieves a paginated list of account mappings between PagerDuty and Jira Cloud.
This endpoint allows you to view all configured connections between PagerDuty accounts and Jira Cloud instances.
Use pagination parameters to navigate through large sets of mappings.

Scoped OAuth requires: `jira_cloud_accounts.read`
get.summary: Get a paginated list of account mappings

get.description:
Retrieves detailed information about a specific account mapping between PagerDuty and Jira Cloud.
This endpoint allows you to view the mapping of a single connection, including the associated
PagerDuty account and Jira Cloud instance details.

Scoped OAuth requires: `jira_cloud_accounts.read`

Retrieves a paginated list of synchronization rules for a specific account mapping between PagerDuty and Jira Cloud.
These rules define how incidents in PagerDuty are synchronized with issues in Jira Cloud.
Use this endpoint to view and manage the integration behavior for a particular account connection.
Pagination parameters allow for efficient navigation through large sets of rules.

Scoped OAuth requires: `jira_cloud_rules.read`
get.summary: Get a paginated list of rules

post.description:
This operation allows you to create a new synchronization rule that defines how PagerDuty incidents
are mapped to Jira issues. The rule specifies the conditions for creating issues, field mappings,
status synchronization, and other integration details between PagerDuty and Jira.

Scoped OAuth requires: `jira_cloud_rules.write`

value.name: Critical Incidents to Jira IT Support

delete.description:
Deletes a synchronization rule between PagerDuty and Jira Cloud.
These rules define how incidents in PagerDuty are synchronized with issues in Jira Cloud.
Use this endpoint to manage the integration behavior for a particular account connection.
This operation removes the rule from the account and deletes the associated webhook from PagerDuty.

Scoped OAuth requires: `jira_cloud_rules.write`

get.description:
Retrieves detailed information about a specific synchronization rule between PagerDuty and Jira Cloud.
This endpoint provides comprehensive configuration data for a single rule, including issue type mappings,
project details, status mappings, and custom field configurations.

Scoped OAuth requires: `jira_cloud_rules.read`

put.description:
This operation allows you to update an existing synchronization rule between PagerDuty and Jira.
You can modify various aspects of the rule, including its name, enabled status, and configuration details.
This includes Jira project settings, issue type, status mappings, priority mappings, custom field mappings,
and the associated PagerDuty service.

Scoped OAuth requires: `jira_cloud_rules.write`

value.name: Critical Incidents to Jira IT Support
